item.title: Charles Schwab backs Singapore’s Qapita, a Carta challenger
item.description: Charles Schwab and Singapore-based Qapita have teamed up to launch a new service to help U.S. startups manage cap tables and employee stock plans.

item.title: Revolut aims to take on Indian banks and their ‘criminal’ forex fees
item.description: Revolut plans to onboard 20 million users in India by 2030 and process more than $7 billion in transactions.

item.title: You can’t libel the dead. But that doesn’t mean you should deepfake them.
item.description: "Please, just stop sending me AI videos of Dad," the late Robin Williams' daughter Zelda wrote on Instagram.

item.title: Trump’s DOE proposes cutting billions in grants for GM, Ford, and lots of startups
item.description: Trump's Department of Energy wants to cancel billions more in awards that were granted by the Biden administration, and startups are in the crosshairs...

item.title: Wall Street analysts explain how AMD’s own stock will pay for OpenAI’s billions in chip purchases
item.description: AMD's unusual deal to finance OpenAI's chip purchases could grant the AI model maker up to $100 billion, analyst estimates.
